comments.body:
@pingsutw could you test multiple time zone as the default, similar to https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/32878?
Also, we should test input strings with time zone like `2021-06-14 15:01:24+08:00` as well, which expects `2021-06-14 15:01:24`.
As I mentioned in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-35720, I don't think we can simply use `stringToTimestamp` here. You will find that when you have more test cases here.
@gengliangwang thanks for the review. Will update ASAP.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1298,1302 @@
  test("SPARK-35720: Support casting of String to timestamp without time zone type") {
    specialTs.foreach { s =>
      val expectedTs = LocalDateTime.parse(s)
      checkEvaluation(cast(Literal(s), TimestampWithoutTZType), expectedTs)

comments.body: This is a trivial change for the test case. There is no need to replace the space.
can we put `T` in the strings directly?

well, the result won't contain the "T", so we have to replace one of them eventually.
The test inputs are from https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/sql/catalyst/src/test/scala/org/apache/spark/sql/RandomDataGenerator.scala#L156
